column5: Great job L.A. If only my kids kept their tackle box looking that nice!!
i have some to they about $22 and they work excellent

I have only really used the leeches for rock bass and perch fishing dock side. For those species i find they work good. As for SM&LM bass i have not really used them yet. I am going to try a lot of drop shot rigs with these might even throw them on jig heads. I will try them this weekend and tell you how they work.  Mike

Great job LA.... Your box is clean and organize.  When I was 13, I did not have a box, I used my fathers and eventually became mine because I was using it more than him.    I still have old lures that I carry in it but don't use anymore.... it's of sentimental value.  Again good job and I'm sure you'll find & buy more lures to add to your arsenal.  Leechman
You guys both have excellent starts.   Might want to look into some toned-down patterns for clear water.  I'm not a Booyah fan, but something like this:
Just cleaned out y'old tackle box pretty good for a 13 year old i think
Nice selection.....keep er growing!
Keep casting that yellow musky bucktail and you'll get one fer sure!! I love that one.....  Sinker
Nice... but where'r the senkos?   I've yet gotten any fish, not even a single bite, with any hard bait... arh
I wish my tackle box looked like that at 13
I wish mine looked like that at 62.  JF
One lure that you have in your tackle box singlehandedly caught me 7 Northern Pike this past weekend up on Georgian Bay. I'll let you guess which one..
Nice selection LA, you may want to look into getting some plastics though for the Bass, they love Senko's and tubes  Maureen

Nice stash you got there LA. When i was around your age, I bought 1-2 lures everytime I go fishing (usually drop by a tackle shop for worms).... and now i have a huge tackle bag full of'em .  You seem to like the yellow/chartuese theme alot! If you don't mind me making one suggestion, is that i'd say you can add a few more "natural color-ed" baits to your arsenal.
LOL that's funny John!  Nice setup L.A. - Get yourself some soft plastics and you're all set!
When I was 13, my tackle box had a few red and white bobbers, about 3 hooks and a few pieces of lead shot.  And it stayed that way until I was 36....LOL.

:lol:  Not that long of a time period for me, but I didn't own a tackle box when I was 13.  I think I just shoved the spinners, hooks, sinkers, and.................YES!!!!!!  THE RED AND WHITE BOBBERS!!!" in a few of the pockets of an old canvas backpack handed down to me from my dad.
Similar to my collection, just add 50 or so more spinner baits...
Well done LA but no Red Devil?!?!?! It must be tough building a tackle stash these days - not only is everything $8+ but the options are rediculous! How do you just pick one? -Brian
lookin good but....MORE SPINNERBAITS
Nice man good start mine use to look like that then i started working and well made some upgrades  and box started to fill up

i have the yamamoto's and some yum and im buying some gulp live. And the spinner baits i have are up on stop you cant see them very well i have maybe 4 then another 8 my dad keeps those though. My dad and i both like to share lures a bond between a son and his dad,nothing like it!

Good start dude!  I have to admit when I was 13 I was lucky to have my grandfather and my dad donating lures they didn't use to me all the time. I don't think I've had just ONE tackle box since I was six..
PPPFFFFFF.  You need only one bait in that box.. That firetiger HJ 13..  HD
Rock bass lure IMO
Thats a good box. But where is the soft plastics and the GULP!!!

I don't want to take over your thread but i think my opponent should know what i am working with this summer. This just shows the difference of 3 years of getting fishing supplies.  Spinnerbaits  Gulp Alive  Soft Plastics1  Soft Plastics2  Gulp  Yum Scent  Hooks,weights etc...  Basic Tools  Lures1  Lures2
very nice all the yum and soft baits i have you cant see in the picture they are in the bottom portion of my box.how are the gulp leeches may i ask? and how much?
